pros:
Youth Sport Trust is a young person’s charity that drives much-needed societal change through the power of sport & play. Harnessing these two core values to strengthen communities, foster inclusion & diversity and build leadership skills for young people.

As a non-binary, non-heterosexual individual I have always felt welcomed at Youth Sport Trust, with the organisation promoting inclusion and diversity from the very heart of the charity. I have never felt uncomfortable, nor judged for my differences.

Youth Sport Trust is also an organisation that fosters personal development, with multiple CPD opportunities available for those who want to continually progress and develop themselves Youth Sport Trust is a fantastic workplace to be part of.

My experience thus far at YST has been fantastic, a fast-paced, welcoming environment with superb personal development opportunities. I cannot empathise with how fulfilling working at YST is, the nature of our work allows us to have a direct impact on young people's lives.
cons: My expierence at YST has been overwhelmingly positive.

pros: It is a fabulous place and charity to work. The people who work at the Youth Sport Trust are just amazing. There are great opportunities to grow, hours of work are flexible and whatever your role you know you are making a difference to the lives of young people.
cons: Supporting young people never stops, there is always something to do.

job_title: Monitoring, Evaluation and Research Officer in Nottingham, England
pros: The people who work for YST are the kindest colleagues, and are strongly driven by the mission to improve the lives of children and young people. The team ethos from everyone across the organisation makes it such a rewarding place to work.
cons: It is sometimes difficult to know how to progress within the organisation from within. There are good CPD opportunities but not a clear pathway towards promotion within the team or more widely within the organisation

pros: Good people with an organisation doing good things for young people
Values led. Comprehensive EDI strategy. Numerous opportunities for growth. Diverse projects to be involved in. Colleagues are amazing.
cons: Takes some time to understand the various programmes that are being delivered and how each connect with one-another.

pros: Great cause and a clear passion from all leaders.  Collaborative across departments and fun during volunteering opportunities like conferences and camps. A real sense of Team amongst employees.
cons: Excessive workload and expectations. They work you until you break. I know of many employees off with stress (including myself) and ultimately the reason why I chose to leave.
